results.title: Mitosis and mitotic poisons = Mitose und mitosegifte
results.creator_credit: Institut für Film und Bild and Professor H Lette
results.brief_description: Cultures are grown from the heart of a chicken embryo and the behaviour of the original and subcultures is shown. The process of cell division is photographed at a magnification of 250 and in more detail using oil-immersion at a magnification of 900. The inhibition of mitosis by the presence in the culture medium of various substances is studied. The action which inhibits mitosis varies from an adhesion of the chromosomes which are attempting to divide in the presence of trypaflavin to an explosion of the cells attempting division in the presence of adrenalin. Captions in German.

results.title: Mitosis
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology Program. Unit 5. Heredity and Adaptive Change”.
Shows a mitosis actually taking place in a living cell. Demonstrates the effects of chemicals and radiation on dividing cells. Discusses the importance of mitosis to the growth and maintenance of an organism. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Mister Prime Minister: Robert Gordon Menzies
results.brief_description: Documents the life and political career of Sir Robert Menzies, Prime Minister of Australia during 1939-1941 and 1949-1966, shown in contemporary film scenes. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Mister Prime Minister: Joseph Benedict Chifley
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and Tom Haydon
results.brief_description: The life and political career of J.B. Chifley, Prime Minister of Australia 1945-1949. Covers his early life and rise through the ranks of the ALP; notes the record amount of legislation passed furing his term of office, and presents interviews with associates. Narrated by Roger Climpson. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Mister prime minister: Alfred Deakin
results.brief_description: Provides an overview of Deakin’s life from his birth in a northern inner suburb of Melbourne in 1856 to his death in 1919, and closely examines his involvement in the Federation movement and his dominance of the first decade of Federal politics. Narrated by Roger Climpson.

results.title: Mission: Australia (PC & MAC)
results.creator_credit: Garner MacLennan Interactive and Mission Australia Consortium
results.brief_description: What kind of place will Australia be in the future? Join Aunty M the River Red Gum and a whole host of fascinating characters on an interactive mission to maintain some of Australia’s uniquely beautiful environments and preserve its distinctive flora and fauna. Enter the simulator and journey to the coast, an estuary, an arid rangeland, or even the city where you will encounter environmental problems, and be offered a wide range of suggestions to solve them, but keep in mind every action wins a score. Some solutions might not rate in terms of human prosperity, but will drastically improve the environment. Alternatively, some solutions will benefit humans, but impact negatively on our surroundings. Your mission is to find a logical balance between profit and preservation before it’s too late. Beautiful graphics, easy to install and very user-friendly. Teacher’s notes and class activity sheets can be downloaded from the CD. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: For Windows, 486 DX2/66 or better (Pentium recommended) running Windows 95/Windows 3.1, 16 megabytes or more of RAM. Double speed or faster CD-ROM drive (Quad speed recommended). Sound card (stereo 16-bit recommened), and 640X480 Super VGA display (256 colour or better). For Macintosh, 68040 or better (Power PC recommended) running Mac OS System 7.5 or later, 8 megabytes of free RAM. Double-speed or faster CD-ROM drive (Quad speed recommended), 640X480 display (256 colour or better).

results.title: Mission to no man's land
results.creator_credit: Stanley Wright, Rank Screen Services, Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees and Georges Pessis
results.brief_description: A tour of a typical Austrian refugee camp, showing something of the extent of the problem. Yul Brynner records interviews with the refugees. One particularly moving sequence shows an elderly refugee talking on the long distance telephone with his family in the United States.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stanley Wright, Rank Screen Services, Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees and Georges Pessis

results.title: Miss, Mrs, or Ms: what's it all about?
results.brief_description: Reports on the progress being made by feminist philosophies, showing that the stereotyping of traditional roles is decreasing in American society. Narrated by: Sylvia Chase, Christopher Glenn.
